meanings.definition: Belief in the legitimacy of a ruler or government.
meanings.sent1: Her legitimism was unwavering, always supporting the ruler.
meanings.sent2: The legitimism of the government was questioned by the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The legitimism of the ruler was so strong, even the birds sang about it.
meanings.sent4: In the kingdom of legitimism, the ruler's word was law.
meanings.sent5: The legitimism of the government was like a sturdy castle, standing firm against doubt.

meanings.definition: The principles or policies of those who believe in the legitimacy of a ruler or government.
meanings.sent1: Their legitimism guided their decisions in governance.
meanings.sent2: The legitimism of the party shaped their political strategies.
meanings.sent3: The legitimism of the ruler's advisors led to some interesting debates.
meanings.sent4: In the world of legitimism, loyalty to the ruler was paramount.
meanings.sent5: The legitimism of the government was a beacon of stability in uncertain times.
